intro: Hoffmannseggia arequipensis, commonly known as the Arequipa hoffmannseggia, is a flowering plant native to the high Andean regions of Peru. It belongs to the family Cactaceae and is characterized by its spiny stems and clusters of small, yellowish flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils at elevations above 3,500 meters. It has adapted to the harsh, cold, and arid conditions of its native habitat through its succulent stems and reduced leaves. Hoffmannseggia arequipensis is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and ecological significance in high-altitude ecosystems.
